Posts.Content: Aug 30, 2013 12:42PM lulu89 wrote: I was diagonised with it in dec 2012. We did 10 radiations to my spine from c5 to t3 I think. They was afraid i was never going to walk if i didnt do it right away. In Jan we began innerthiecal chemo if methitrexate in my skull and abraxane thru my reg port. The cancer was not visable on my april mri. We finished at the end of may. In july it did show again so started my methatrxiate on mon and also havalin. THERE IS HOPE. I have came alot farther than they thought and can walk fine. Just a little clumsey sometime. LuAnn
Posts.Title: Leptominingeal carcinoma tadpole lulu89

Posts.Content: Oct 2, 2012 09:59PM lulu89 wrote: Bestbird, I have asked him in the past about removing my ovaries but he never seemed liked he thought it was necessary.  I had a pseudomas infection from my expanders which had to be removed so between 12 weeks of IV's and oral meds on and off maybe thats is why.  I am doing my best at eating really healthy with no meat but I am not sure how long I can do this.  I am like you and like my protein and dairy.    LuAnn, its good to know it wont be so bad if they do a biopsy.  I asked him that day if he was going to do one on my liver and he said no.  Never thought about a bone one tho.  The way they talked when I had my infection so bad they acted like for that they couldnt do one then becauce it wouldnt heal but that was where I had radiation at too.   Now looking back what if infection was really the cancer and they missed it.  I guess we always have all these "what if's" in the back of our mind.  Also I just got a copy of all my scans the other day just because I wanted to know exactly what I am up against.  I just need to get copies of all the other stuff to put in my binder.  I have all my local stuff but not as much from St. Louis.
Posts.Title: Overwhelmed lulu89 Just_Sue
Need help from those with mastectomies Frapp Heidihill

Posts.Content: lulu89 wrote: I was told in Dec. 2010 I had breast cancer.  It was lobular with one lympy node out of 14 with cancer in it also.  Did everything to lessen my chance which included bi-latteral mastomacy, chemo and radiation.  Now I am told it is back and is on my liver, in my bones (alot of them it appears) and report looks like even on my lung.  I am only 41.  They say we just need  to shut down my horomones with fluvestrant and Arimidex.  Apparently Tomixfen didn't work. They say we are trying to by some time with this type of treatment then move on to another before chemo.  My tumor markers are 525 and were only 22 six months ago.  Is there any other women out there with the same thing that has happened to them.  I am thinking about a second oppinion also at MD Anderson.  I hear how eating a vegan diet also helps fight this and have even looked into vitamin c infusions.  I just dont know what to think or do at this point.  One minute you think you have just normal aches and pains or at least thats what the docor says and then your world just crashes down.  I guess I am just venting too but it is just too real at this point.  Anyone with any insight I would be glad to hear from.  I havent got on this web site for almost a year but it always seemed to help me cope by reading how we have all dealt with these horrible situations. LuLu Dx 12/10/2010, ILC, 6cm+, Stage IIA, Grade 2, 1/14 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 1/5/2011 Mastectomy: Left; Prophylactic mastectomy: Right Chemotherapy 2/23/2011 Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Ellence (epirubicin), Fluorouracil (5-fluorouracil, 5-FU, Adrucil), Taxotere (docetaxel) Hormonal Therapy 9/11/2011 Dx 9/14/2012, ILC, 6cm+, Stage IV, 1/14 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Hormonal Therapy 9/14/2012 Arimidex (anastrozole) Chemotherapy 10/11/2012 Xeloda (capecitabine) Radiation Therapy 12/10/2012 Chemotherapy 1/4/2013 Abraxane (albumin-bound or nab-paclitaxel), Methotrexate (Amethopterin, Mexate, Folex) Radiation Therapy 7/31/2013 Lymph nodes Chemotherapy 8/26/2013 Halaven (eribulin), Methotrexate (Amethopterin, Mexate, Folex) Radiation Therapy Breast, Lymph nodes Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Overwhelmed lulu89 Just_Sue

Posts.Content: Sep 1, 2013 02:54PM lulu89 wrote: I also took diflucan when I got it when taking a steriod and radiation to my c part of spine. He had me take it every day for a week along with magic mouthwash. Hope you feel better soon. LuAnn
Posts.Title: Thrush from Prednisone Karen2012 Karen2012

Posts.Content: Oct 2, 2012 08:26PM lulu89 wrote: LuAnn, This is so weird to find someone with the same name as me ( spelled the same even) and here were in the same boat.  To answer your question no they havent re-biopsyd anything.  That is one of my questions for him on Thurs.  I have only talked with him the day he told me the news again so Thurs will be my first chance.  I am already going to a bigger facility.  Its Sitemans in St Louis but im just really nervous because four days before he told me it was back, I was telling him I didn't feel right with my aches and pains and I thought my red blood count was off he had said everything was fine.  My body had just been thru alot.  Now I dont trust any doctors at this point because it has been about three months that I have been complaining to different docs and always same thing, I have been thru alot.  Today has probably been one of my better days in last few weeks with pain so dont know if its the meds, diet or just not working all day long anymore for a while.  All of you ladies are great on this site.  It is nice to have someone to talk to that has been there too.  Thanks everyone for the info and encourgement.  And lanagraves, I agree totally.
Posts.Title: Overwhelmed lulu89 Just_Sue

Posts.Content: Oct 1, 2012 09:18PM lulu89 wrote: Thanks for the infor girls.  Any and all is appreciated.  I have a page full of questions for the doctor on Thursday because this will be the first time I have seen him since he told me the news.  I just had my seond set of two shots.  He would like me to get on a trial too but that is a story in itself.  Found out our state has more to say on it than my husbands insurance does.  Its a state funded plan for employees and never dreamed of all the whoops to jump thru.
